thread.title: The Best of Baking giveaway - Prize draw worth more than £3,700
thread.title_full: The Best of Baking giveaway - Prize draw worth more than £3,700 - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: The Best of Baking giveaway - Prize draw worth more than £3,700
text: We’ve teamed up with well-known household brands such as Joseph Joseph, Magimix and Kenwood to offer readers the chance to win one of many fantastic baking prizes. The prize draw is packed with all the baking essentials, from the latest kitchen technology with the Magimix Patissier multifunction, to five luxury Le Creuset baking sets. Prizes include: 1 X Magimix Patissier Multifunction - 4 X Cooks Professional Stand Mixer - 3 X Joseph Joseph Baking Tools Sets (Elevate™ Baking Tools, Nest™ 9 Plus, CookBook™ and Adjustable Rolling Pin) - 2 X Andrew James Baking Sets (5.2 Litre Food Mixer, Multifunctional Food Processor, Budding Baker 8 Piece Bakeware, Hand Blender and Processor, Budding Baker Biscuit Making Kit and 5 tier cupcake stand) - 5 X Le Creuset Bakeware sets (Les Swiss Roll Tray – perfect for the Roulade, Rectangular Baking Sheet – for the Couronne, 28cm Rectangular Cake Tin – For Chilli Beef Corn Pie, 20cm Sponge/Sandwich Tin and Baking Accessories Kit) - 6 X Taylor’s Eye Witness Black Round Paddle 35cm - 1 X Exclusive Baking Collection, from Robert Dyas (Kenwood Bread Maker, Salter Stand Mixer, Russell Hobbs Illumina Food Processor and much more) Can't wait to find out if you've won? Click here to see our full range of cookware are The Telegraph Shop. How to enter: Simply fill in the form below, entering the five digit code printed in paper on either Saturday, October 10 or Sunday, October 11. If you have both codes, enter the competition twice using each code to double your chances of winning. By entering, you are agreeing to be kept up-to-date with the latest products, offers and promotions from Telegraph Shop. You can change your email preferences at any time. Online Form - The Best of Baking giveaway - Prize draw worth more than £3,700 telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
